span.strong: Important Updates on the COVID-19 from the Rome City School District

div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/trbAGumABgtVYeg6giXtabTo0fKd26HGCO4tcGA8iNw7xFQ5uyJ3pEQM1Ul1-etO-HA-wmsI=w16383);

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, The Rome City School District Superintendent's Update on COVID-19

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Chromebook sign-up is not accepting new responses at this point in time. Chromebook pickups for only those who have pre-registered before April 5th will continue on Monday, April 13th at our district office (409 Bell Road).

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Please use the link below to sign-up for a Chromebook if you still do not have a device at home that works with Google Classroom or Google Meet.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

h2.div: ILearning Plan During COVID-19 Emergency - April 7, 2020

a.strong: IMPORTANT UPDATE FOR STAFF AND COMMUNITY

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: The Rome City School District has been closed by Governor Cuomo’s Executive Order due to COVID-19 until May 15th, 2020. In addition, all residents are encouraged by the department of health and the CDC to stay home and stop the spread of COVID-19. As a result, all Rome City School District’s facilities, including playgrounds, athletic fields, tracks, gymnasiums are closed to the public until further notice. The only exception to this closure is are our elementary schools from 10:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. for the meal program.

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: The City of Rome, Mayor Jacqueline M. Izzo and Rome City School District Superintendent, Peter Blake today announced that they have extended the property tax and school district tax payment deadline from April 30, 2020 to May 29, 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: “We realize taxpayers face many economic difficulties at this time, and we hope the extension of the April tax payment to May will help ease the tax burden with so many of our citizens currently out of work due to the coronavirus pandemic,” said Mayor, Jacqueline M. Izzo and Superintendent, Peter Blake.
